intro: Lippia dulcis var. mexicana, commonly known as Mexican honeyflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry to moist habitats. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
